title: About
text: “Interstellar for Consultation Services” is an Egyptian data analytics company that is specialized in developing small to medium robust shiny applications and R packages to meet a variety of custom analytics needs

title: Interstellar for Consultation Services
text: We develop small to medium robust shiny applications and R packages to meet a variety of custom analytics and deployment needs especially in Bioinformatics and Chemoinformatics domains. In addition to developing and maintaining robust R packages (open source and private packages) to meet our customers needs

title: Interstellar for Consultation Services
text:
Interstellar is interested in contributing to Open Source Software (OSS) community with many R packages and shiny applications. Such as:

dbparser: for parsing online drugs databases as DrugBank
dbdataset: data package contains parsed DrugBank db in dvobject R list format
covid19dbcand: a smaller version from dbdataset package that contains different tibbles that constitute the dataset parsed from DrugBank.
periscope: cooperated with Aggregate Genius to provide a scalable and UI-standardized ‘shiny’ framework including a variety of developer convenience functions with the goal of both streamlining robust application development and assisting in creating a consistent user experience regardless of application or developer.

title: R in Cheminformatics, Cioinformatics, Drug Discovery and Healthcare
text: In case you are interested in using R language for developing data analysis or ML applications for bio related fields as Cheminformatics, Drug Discovery, Bioinformatics, or Healthcare in general, the following quick survey will help you to show different cases in that already done in R:

title: R in Cheminformatics, Cioinformatics, Drug Discovery and Healthcare
text:
BioConductor
BioConductor is a great place of R packages that focuses mainly on bio related fields and a very good place to start studying R in bio. It provides open source and (open development) tools for the analysis and comprehension of high-throughput genomic data using R. It has two releases each year, 800+ software packages, and a great and highly active user community.
The following are few resource you can start browsing to start knowing BioConductor:

BioConductor Capabilities: This course covers BiocCnductor capabilities and it is renewable
BioConductor: This channel full of different cases in bio in general including all topics above
Most famous BioConductor SW
Most famous BioConductor WF
Different fields formal learning materials:

Orchestrating Single-Cell Analysis with Bioconductor
RNA Sequencing 
Feature generation for chemical compounds, proteins, DNA/RNA
Cheminformatics Toolkit for R
BioMedR: Feature generation for chemical compounds, proteins, DNA/RNA

title: R in Cheminformatics, Cioinformatics, Drug Discovery and Healthcare
text:
Other Resources
The following are free learning resources and tools in different topics:

Big Book of R for Life Sciences
Chemoinformatics:

RCDK
BioChemical Library
ChemmineR: Cheminformatics package for analyzing drug-like small molecule data in R
Journal of Cheminformatics
Cheminformatics tools in R

Bioinformatics:

R Bioinformatics Cookbook
Computational Genomics with R
Bioinformatics and Biostatistics
Structural Bioinformatics

Drug Discovery

The Role of R in Drug Discovery, Research, and Development

Health Care:

R in Healthcare

title: R in Cheminformatics, Cioinformatics, Drug Discovery and Healthcare
text:
Conferences
There are multiple annual related conferences to discuss R updates relating to these fields as:

R in Pharma: The conference for all things R related in the Pharma industry
BioConductor Conference
R in Medicine: The R/Medicine conference and community promote the development and use of R based tools to improve clinical research and practice.
You may want to share any more resources in comments below :).
